message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.AR 

Reasoning: 
- cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely category as the paper investigates the ergodic capacity of distributed antennas under different channel side information assumptions. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is also likely as the paper investigates the effect of antenna placement on the performance of distributed antenna systems, which is relevant to wireless network optimization. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control) is another possible category as the paper presents a framework for optimization of node placement in wireless networks, which can be seen as a control problem. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia) is less likely but still possible as the paper deals with the performance of the downlink channel, which is relevant to multimedia transmission. 
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) is also less likely but possible as the paper discusses the placement of transmit antennas, which can be seen as a hardware architecture problem.
